This chunk is part of a larger work detailing the mathematical derivation of view-space coordinates from screen-space data. It specifically focuses on solving for x_view and z_view in terms of screen-space values (x_screen, y_screen) and depth, utilizing algebraic manipulation and precomputed projection constants (x_proj, z_proj). The context involves breaking down complex transformations into manageable equations to facilitate efficient computation in graphics programming.

$$\begin{aligned} \begin{aligned} x_{screen} &= \frac{x_{clip}}{w_{clip}} \\ x_{screen} &= \frac{x_{view} \cdot A}{y_{view}} \\ x_{screen} \cdot y_{view} &= x_{view} \cdot A \\ x_{screen} \cdot \frac{0.5D}{depth - 0.5 - 0.5B} &= x_{view} \cdot A \\ \frac{x_{screen} \cdot 0.5D}{depth - 0.5 - 0.5B} &= x_{view} \cdot A \\ \frac{x_{screen} \cdot \frac{0.5D}{A}}{depth - 0.5 - 0.5B} &= x_{view} \\ x_{view} &= \frac{x_{screen} \cdot \frac{0.5D}{A}}{depth - 0.5 - 0.5B} \end{aligned} \end{aligned}$$

$$\begin{aligned} \begin{aligned} y_{screen} &= \frac{y_{clip}}{w_{clip}} \\ y_{screen} &= \frac{z_{view} \cdot C}{y_{view}} \\ y_{screen} \cdot y_{view} &= z_{view} \cdot C \\ y_{screen} \cdot \frac{0.5D}{depth - 0.5 - 0.5B} &= z_{view} \cdot C \\ \frac{y_{screen} \cdot 0.5D}{depth - 0.5 - 0.5B} &= z_{view} \cdot C \\ \frac{y_{screen} \cdot \frac{0.5D}{C}}{depth - 0.5 - 0.5B} &= z_{view} \\ z_{view} &= \frac{y_{screen} \cdot \frac{0.5D}{C}}{depth - 0.5 - 0.5B} \end{aligned} \end{aligned}$$
